qas.question: Where did the North American hunter-gathers mostly live?
What basic trait do all hunter-gatherers share?
What is it about the tool styles that is remarkable?
Where have early Paleo -Indian tools been found?
How many members did the mobile tool-making hunters often have?
Which group was spread over small geographical area?
All individual groups shared a uncommon style of what?
These tool adaptations have been utilized by highly sedentary what?
Hunter-gatherers would never flourish over the what?
There were very few regional variations in lifestyles among which group?

context: Hunter-gatherers would eventually flourish all over the <b8_0>Americas<b8_0/>, primarily based in the <a0_0>Great Plains<a0_0/> of the United States and Canada, with offshoots as far east as the Gaspé Peninsula on the Atlantic coast, and as far south as Chile, Monte Verde.[citation needed] <b5_0><b9_0>American hunter-gatherers<b9_0/><b5_0/> were spread over a wide geographical area, thus there were regional variations in lifestyles. However, all the individual groups shared a <a2_0>common style<a2_0/> of <a1_0><b6_0>stone tool production<b6_0/><a1_0/>, making knapping styles and progress identifiable. This early Paleo-Indian period lithic reduction tool adaptations have been found <a3_0>across the Americas<a3_0/>, utilized by highly mobile <b7_0>bands<b7_0/> consisting of approximately <a4_0>25 to 50 members<a4_0/> of an extended family.
